event.title: Suggestions from your public for
event.description:
Suggestions from your public for what should go inside proposed Clear Lake health and fitness center include an household playground, pickleball courts, a climbing wall plus a swimming pool.

Area residents presented those idea and many more during a listening publish on Wednesday night attended by a lot more than 50 people.

Carrie Tysdahl said Clear Lake needs a recreational facility the whole family can use year-round.

She said she has memberships at a gym from the community that has digital cameras, but there’s nowhere to search with her children in the winter where they could shoot hoops while she walks or runs, or "where you can play together. "

The idea for a community wellness center began because school district needed extra gym space.

Doug Gee, superintendent of Clear Lake Community Universities, recently approached city officials regarding the possibility of the city and also the school working together to develop a wellness center that is going to be used by both students and the public.

Tysdahl said this type of facility also presents a chance for the city’s parks and recreation department to provide adult leagues for sports just like volleyball and basketball.

Chelsy Snyder said even through summer, when plenty of outdoor recreation opportunities are available in Clear Lake, the weather is usually too hot for small children to be outside.

If it’s built, a wellness center "is going to be utilized year-round, " the girl said.

Some of those on the meeting said Clear Sea needs another indoor mishaps.
